decoder

Class DecoderImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoder.DecoderImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Decoder

    public class DecoderImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Decoder
    This class represents a decoder that will take prefix codes and store them. It then allows a user to take a coded message and convert it to it's actual message. It uses a tree to store and retrieve the coded message.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DecoderImpl(java.lang.String allowedCode)
      This is the constructor that creates a tree for storing the codes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCode(char symbol, java.lang.String code)
      This method will add characters and their associated code to the tree as a new leaf.
      java.lang.String allCodes()
      This method will display all of the symbols and the code associated with it in the format y:xxxx where y is the symbol and xxxx is the code.
      java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String code)
      This method takes a string and decodes it into the symbols based on the code tree.
      boolean isCodeComplete()
      This method checks if the tree is complete.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecoderImpl

        public DecoderImpl(java.lang.String allowedCode)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This is the constructor that creates a tree for storing the codes. The user inputs the characters that are allowed to be used for the coding. This constructor allows all ASCII characters. Repeated characters will be treated as one character. Entering "" will not result in any code being stored in the tree.
        Parameters:
        allowedCode - This is a string that contains all of the characters allowed for the code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws the exception when the input is null or empty.

    • Method Detail

      • addCode

        public void addCode(char symbol,
                    java.lang.String code)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method will add characters and their associated code to the tree as a new leaf. Empty codes will be ignored. Typing in the same symbol will not overwrite existing code for the same symbol. This method will create all of the parent nodes needed to reach the leaf. Leafs cannot be converted into a parent node.
        Specified by:
        addCode in interface Decoder
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol that the code represents, as a character.
        code - The code that will represent the symbol.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - This method will throw an exception if the code has characters not allowed, or the symbol has already been input into the tree as a code.

      • allCodes

        public java.lang.String allCodes()
        This method will display all of the symbols and the code associated with it in the format y:xxxx where y is the symbol and xxxx is the code.
        Specified by:
        allCodes in interface Decoder
        Returns:
        Returns as a string all of the symbols and codes input so far.

      • decode

        public java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String code)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method takes a string and decodes it into the symbols based on the code tree. The string cannot have characters not part of the coding characters.
        Specified by:
        decode in interface Decoder
        Parameters:
        code - Enter the code that you want to decode into symbols.
        Returns:
        Outputs the symbols as a string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Throws an exception when the code doesn't match any symbol, or if there is a character input that is not allowed or a blank space.

      • isCodeComplete

        public boolean isCodeComplete()
        This method checks if the tree is complete. This means that the number of nodes at each parent is equal to the number of unique characters allowed in the code. It means that any code with those characters can be decoded.
        Specified by:
        isCodeComplete in interface Decoder
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the code tree is complete.
